title: 2-year-old girl shot in head in drive-by on Cleveland's East Side
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A 2-year-old girl was shot in the head and arm Friday night on Cleveland's East Side, police said.
The toddler was wounded during a drive-by shooting about 7 p.m. on the 4100 block of East 146th Street in the city's Corlett neighborhood, Cleveland police spokeswoman Sgt. Jennifer Ciaccia said. She was hit once in the head and once in the arm.
The girl was taken to University Hospitals Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital in "unstable condition," Cleveland EMS Capt. James said in a phone interview.
The girl was in surgery for several hours and was admitted to the intensive care unit about 11:30 p.m., Ciaccia said.
Officers are following up on leads in the shooting, but no arrests have been made, Ciaccia said. Crime scene investigators cleared the shooting scene about 8:30 p.m.
A 2-year-old child was taken to Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital in unstable condition, Cleveland EMS said.
Last year, three children younger than 5 years old were killed within four weeks in drive-by shootings on Cleveland's East Side.
Ramon Burnett, 5, was killed Sept. 4 while playing football at his grandmother's house. One of the five people charged in Burnett's death, Marlon Hackett, was sentenced to life in prison after pleading guilty in June.
Major Howard, 3, was killed in a drive-by while seated in his car seat on East 113th Street, near Regalia Avenue. Howard's suspect shooter, Donnell Lindsey, was at-large until he was arrested in May by the U.S. Marshals just outside Atlanta, Georgia.
The youngest drive-by victim, Aavielle Wakefield, was shot dead Oct. 1 while riding in a car with her family. She was five months old.
Two men have been arrested and charged in connection with Aavielle's death. They are awaiting trial.
